Dear Yulonda W Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
1

intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/10/24, youth was upset, aggressive, and escalated with staff.
Youth attempted to get into a restroom where another youth was
getting dressed. The youth pushed past staff to get inside. Youth
reports that a staff member grabbed her by the neck.
Investigation Interviews:
On 09/13/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Consumer
Rights Officer. He confirmed that Youth A is placed in Freedom
Hall as of 9/10/2024. He reported that Youth A was involved in a
big truancy plot and as a result was moved to Freedom Hall at
Vista. He further advised that Staff 1 was on leave pending the
outcome of the investigation. The disciplinary files for Staff 1 were
reviewed. Consumer Rights officer confirmed that Staff 1 is a
contingent staff member and has been employed with the agency
at least 8 years. There was only one disciplinary action in her file
involving an issue with attendance back in August 2022. He
further advised that there were no marks or bruises on Youth A
and she refused a medical exam.
On 09/13/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Youth A at
Vista Maria. Youth A reported that she was attempting to get into
the restrooms and was told by staff that she needed to wait. She
confirmed that she did not want to wait and pushed past the staff
to enter the restroom. She confirmed that there was two
additional youth and three staff in the restroom. Youth A reported
that she was upset and recalls not responding to directives from
the staff that were present and was swinging her arms and may
have hit one of the staff but could not recall which one. When
asked if the staff attempted to restrain her, she responded that
she was not restrained. She did report that Staff one grabbed her
by her neck. She went on to say that she really likes Staff 1 and
did not want her to get into trouble. She denied that any other
staff hit or grabbed her neck. She denied that any of the staff hit
or grabbed the neck of any of the other youth that were in the
restroom. Youth A stated she was able to get away from the staff
and she left the restroom to go and calm down. She denied that
she has been hit or choked by any other staff or seen any other
staff hit youth at the agency.
2

On 09/26/2024 an in-person conversation was held with the
Complainant and they advised that they had no additional
concerns.
On 09/26/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. She reported that Youth A seemed upset and did not
attend school due to a truancy plot that they believed some of the
youth had planned. Youth B was in the shower and Youth A
wanted to use the restroom. Staff 1 requested that she wait and
Youth A became upset and pushed past Staff 1. Staff 2 did not
recall how but stated that both Youth A and Staff 1 ended up in a
restroom stall. Staff 2 reported seeing Youth A swing on Staff 1.
Staff 2 reported that she told Youth A to stop and then Youth A
started swinging at her also. She reported that she and Staff 1
then grabbed Youth A by the wrist on either side of her. Staff 2
attempted to demonstrate how they grabbed the wrist of Youth A
and it was not assessed to be consistent with CPI behavior
management techniques. She stated that Youth A then started
yelling, “that Bitch choked me”, speaking about Staff 1. Staff 2
reported they then let her go and she exited the bathroom. Staff 2
stated she was able to talk with Youth A once she exited the
bathroom and was finally able to deescalate her. When asked,
Staff 2 admitted that the grab was not consistent with restraint
protocol. Staff 2 also denied seeing Staff 1 place her hands near
the neck of Youth A and denied that either of them where behind
Youth A. She also denied that Youth A made any statements to
her about being grabbed by the neck or being choked.
On 09/20/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B at
Vista Maria. She reported that she did not have any recollection
of the incident between Youth A and Staff 1 that occurred in the
bathroom. She denied any concerns with Staff 1 and denied ever
seeing staff be physically inappropriate with residents. She
reported feeling safe at the agency and denies any concerns. She
lastly denied that Youth A ever told her she was choked by Staff 1
or any other staff.
On 09/29/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
Vista Maria. She reported that she was not involved in the
incident but was sitting behind the desk when Youth A became
escalated. She did not recall what Youth A was upset about.
Staff 3 recalled that Staff 1 was standing in the door of the
bathroom and Youth A was asking her to move so that she could
go in. Youth A then suddenly pushed Staff 1 and went past her to
enter the bathroom. Staff 3 reported that at this point her, Staff 1,
Staff 2 and Youth A all ended up in the bathroom. She recalled
3

that Youth A was still upset and was seen swinging at staff. Staff
1 was seen standing behind Youth A with her arms around her
from the back, however not near her head or neck area. Youth A
was yelling and screaming at everyone, but Staff 3 reported not
recalling what she was specifically saying. Staff 3 denied seeing
Staff 1 or any other staff grab the neck of Youth A. Youth A
eventually calmed down and walked out of the bathroom and
telling staff to “leave her alone”. Staff 3 denied hearing Youth A
say anything about being choked or grabbed by the neck. She
also denied seeing Staff 1 being physically inappropriate with any
residents, including Youth A.
On 09/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Vista Maria. She reported she is an 8-year employee and
currently works as a contingent staff. She recalled that Youth A
was already escalated when she arrived for the morning shift and
did not go to school on this day. Staff 1 reports she was standing
at the door, Youth C was at the sink in the restroom and Youth B
was in the shower. Youth A asked to go into the restroom and
was told no and that she would have to wait. She became
impatient and “bum rushed” past Staff 1. Staff 1 reported that
Youth A was loud and was cursing and not responding to the
directives of staff. Staff 1 stated Youth A began to swing at her
and then Staff 2 entered the restroom. Staff 1 reported she
grabbed and was holding the wrist of Youth A. Staff 2 then
grabbed the other wrist and was trying to deescalate Youth A
verbally. Staff 1 recalled they all ended up in the stall area
together. Both her and Staff 2 continued to hold the wrist of Youth
A as she was yelling. Staff 1 is unsure of what she was saying.
Youth A eventually calmed down, and they all were able to exit the
bathroom area. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A said something
about her choking her or grabbing her neck, but denied that it was
true. Staff 1 recalled stating to Youth A, “I have your arm and I am
not choking you. Staff 1 denied choking or grabbing the neck of
Youth A or any other youth at the facility. When asked, Staff 1
admitted that the grab of the arm/wrist of Youth A was a reflex
response and was not consistent with restraint protocol.
On 09/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
C at Vista Maria. She recalled being in the bathroom area when
the incident occurred. She denied seeing Staff 1 or any other staff
choke or grab the neck of Youth A. She did recall seeing Staff 1
grab the arm of Youth A, but denied seeing any other staff be
physically inappropriate with Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
4

E-mail from Foster Care Specialist - On 09/17/2024 an email
correspondence was received from the assigned Foster Care
Specialist. He reported that he had spoken with Youth A
regarding the incident and she said that she went to push past
Staff 1 and then Staff 1 grabbed her by the neck. He further
reported that Youth A stated she started “swinging” and the staff
put her in an appropriate restraint. Youth A then stated that she
would have done the same thing if she had been pushed the way
that she pushed the staff. Youth A asked that the Foster Care
Worker not get the staff in trouble as this staff does not deserve to
get in trouble and she does not want to see her get in trouble for
this. The Foster Care Worker advised that Youth A had been
moved to another building and was not having contact with the
staff as a part of the safety plan.
Disciplinary File of Staff 1 – Documentation of training
completed by Staff 1. She completed CPI refresher training on
03/30/2024. There was only one area of discipline documented in
her case file relative to attendance back in August 2022.
Incident Report (IR) – IR was dated for 09/10/2024 at
approximately 7:15 AM. It is documented that the incident
occurred in Wing B. IR was signed by Staff 2 and identified the
involvement of Youth A and listed Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 as
witnesses. It documented that at approximately 7:50 am while
one resident was in the restroom and Youth A asked to enter the
bathroom also. Youth A was advised to wait but refused and
pushed past Staff 1 to enter the restroom. Staff 2 came to assist
and then Youth A began to hit both Staff 1 and Staff 2. They then
placed Youth A in a CPI hold for about two minutes. Youth A was
released and exited the restroom. Youth A and another resident
remained escalated and were banging on doors and making
threatening statements toward staff. Staff was eventually able to
calm Youth A utilizing de-escalation techniques.
Nursing Note for Youth A – Noted dated for 9/10/2024. The
note documented that nursing staff was called to the building due
to physical restraint of Youth A. Upon arrival, Youth A was lying in
the bed. She was asked if she was physically restrained, and she
responded no. She also denied having any injuries or any pain.
She further declined request to be assessed for scratches or
bruises. Youth A stated she was fine and wanted to sleep.
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Policy indicates that
the following behaviors are prohibited, and employees who
5

engage in prohibited acts are subject to discipline, up to and
including termination (see Disciplinary Procedure, 022-110):
• Fighting, assaulting, threatening or intimidating co-workers,
security, clients, customers, or guests.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was not sufficient
evidence to support non-compliance with licensing rule 4158.
Both youth and staff were interviewed, and all of the staff and
youth interviewed, except one, denied that Staff 1 choked Youth
A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Behavior Management
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4157 Behavior management.
Section Rule 157. (1) An institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that describe the institution’s behavior
management system. The policies and procedures shall be
reviewed annually and updated as needed. These shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff grabbed and pulled youth by the wrist and utilized
inappropriate behavior management techniques when attempting
to redirect the Youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 09/26/2024 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Vista Maria. She reported that while trying to deescalate Youth A,
she and Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A by the wrist on either side
of her. Staff 2 attempted to demonstrate how they grabbed and
pulled the wrist of Youth A and it was not assessed to be
consistent with CPI behavior management techniques. When
asked, Staff 2 admitted that the grab/pull was not consistent with
restraint protocol. Staff 2 also denied seeing Staff 1 place her
hands near the neck of Youth A and denied that either of them
where behind Youth A. She also denied that Youth A made any
statements to her about being grabbed by the neck or being
choked.
On 09/29/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
Vista Maria. She reported that she was not involved in the
6

incident but was sitting behind the desk when Youth A became
escalated. She recalled that Youth A was still upset and was seen
swinging at staff. Staff 1 was seen standing behind Youth A with
her arms around her from the back, however not near her head or
neck area.
On 09/26/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Vista Maria. Staff 1 reported that Youth A was loud and was
cursing and not responding to the directives of staff. Staff 1 stated
Youth A began to swing at her and then Staff 2 entered the
restroom. Staff 1 reported she grabbed and pulled and was
holding the wrist of Youth A. Staff 2 then grabbed the other wrist
and was trying to deescalate Youth A verbally. Staff 1 recalled
they all ended up in the stall area together. Both her and Staff 2
continued to hold the wrist of Youth A as she was yelling. When
asked, Staff 1 admitted that the grab of the arm/wrist of Youth A
was a reflex response and was not consistent with restraint
protocol.
Documents Reviewed:
Vista Maria Restraint/Behavior Management Policy - To
maintain a safe environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff,
behavior management interventions are only used when a client
presents a danger to self or others. These interventions should
only be used when all other less restrictive behavior management
interventions (i.e., verbal de-escalation, therapeutic interventions)
have been explored. When a client appears to be out of control,
begins to act aggressively or in a way that is harmful to
himself/herself, other clients, and/or staff, it is essential that staff
use the principles trauma informed practice models first including
but not limited to: Behavioral Intervention Support Team (BIST)
and the Risking Connection training model for working with
survivors of trauma and adverse childhood experience. When
circumstances require physical intervention, only physical
intervention techniques per (CPI) may be utilized to intervene.
Corporal punishment in any form is never, under any
circumstances, to be used.
After review of the restraint/behavior management policy it was
assessed that the techniques utilized by the staff were not
documented as approved methods.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4109-1-C. The agency
failed to follow their written behavior management policy. Both
7

Staff 1 and Staff 2 admitted to the use of behavior management
techniques that were not consistent with agency policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001676 CAP Approved
10/30/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
